info.x-termsOfService: IBM provides this older version of the Language Translator v2 API in Swagger version 2.0 format (the "Swagger API"). You may use the Swagger API to provide capabilities or integrations that leverage the older version of the Language Translator v2 API. The Swagger API is provided as-is, and IBM does not make any commitments about the quality, reliability, availability, or ability of the Swagger API to meet your needs.
info.title: Language Translator
info.description:
---

Language Translator v3 is [available](https://www.ibm.com/watson/developercloud/language-translator/api/v3/). See the [migration guide](https://console.bluemix.net/docs/services/language-translator/migrating.html).

---

IBM Watson™ Language Translator translates text from one language to another. The service offers multiple domain-specific models that you can customize based on your unique terminology and language. Use Language Translator to take news from across the globe and present it in your language, communicate with your customers in their own language, and more.

externalDocs.description: For more information about this service, see the docs.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Specify a language code to filter results by source language.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: Specify a language code to filter results by target language.

parameters.name: default
parameters.description: If the default parameter isn't specified, the service will return all models (default and non-default) for each language pair. To return only default models, set this to `true`. To return only non-default models, set this to `false`.

source: curl -u "{username}":"{password}" \
"https://gateway.watsonplatform.net/language-translator/api/v2/models"

import json
from watson_developer_cloud import LanguageTranslatorV2 as LanguageTranslator

language_translator = LanguageTranslator(
    username='{username}',
    password='{password}')

models = language_translator.list_models()
print(json.dumps(models, indent=2))

post.description:
Uploads a TMX glossary file on top of a domain to customize a translation model.

Depending on the size of the file, training can range from minutes for a glossary to several hours for a large parallel corpus. Glossary files must be less than 10 MB. The cumulative file size of all uploaded glossary and corpus files is limited to 250 MB.

parameters.name: base_model_id
parameters.description: The model ID of the model to use as the base for customization. To see available models, use the `List models` method.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: An optional model name that you can use to identify the model. Valid characters are letters, numbers, dashes, underscores, spaces and apostrophes. The maximum length is 32 characters.

parameters.name: forced_glossary
parameters.description: A TMX file with your customizations. The customizations in the file completely overwrite the domain translaton data, including high frequency or high confidence phrase translations. You can upload only one glossary with a file size less than 10 MB per call.

parameters.name: parallel_corpus
parameters.description: A TMX file that contains entries that are treated as a parallel corpus instead of a glossary.

parameters.name: monolingual_corpus
parameters.description: A UTF-8 encoded plain text file that is used to customize the target language model.

400.description: Bad request: The base_model_id is not specified OR you've hit the maximum limit of customizations for this user

404.description: Not found: The base_model_id value is invalid

413.description: File size exceeded: Payload body exceeded the limit

source:
curl -u "{username}":"{password}" \
-X POST \
-F base_model_id="en-es" \
-F name="custom-english-to-spanish" \
-F forced_glossary=@glossary.tmx \
"https://gateway.watsonplatform.net/language-translator/api/v2/models"

import json
from watson_developer_cloud import LanguageTranslatorV2 as LanguageTranslator

language_translator = LanguageTranslator(
  username='{username}',
  password='{password}')

with open('glossary.tmx', 'rb') as glossary:
  response = language_translator.create_model(
    base_model_id = 'en-es',
    name = 'custom-english-to-spanish',
    forced_glossary = glossary)
  print(json.dumps(response, indent=2))

parameters.name: model_id
parameters.description: Model ID of the model to delete.

400.description: Unauthorized: This model was created by IBM

404.description: Not found: The specified model_id was not found

source:
curl -u "{username}":"{password}" \
-X DELETE
"https://gateway.watsonplatform.net/language-translator/api/v2/models/{model_id}"

import json
from watson_developer_cloud import LanguageTranslatorV2 as LanguageTranslator

language_translator = LanguageTranslator(
    username='{username}',
    password='{password}')

model = language_translator.delete_model('123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426655440000')
print(json.dumps(model, indent=2))

get.description: Gets information about a translation model, including training status for custom models.

parameters.name: model_id
parameters.description: Model ID of the model to get

source: curl -u "{username}":"{password}" \
"https://gateway.watsonplatform.net/language-translator/api/v2/models/{model_id}"

import json
from watson_developer_cloud import LanguageTranslatorV2 as LanguageTranslator

language_translator = LanguageTranslator(
  username='{username}',
  password='{password}')

model_details = language_translator.get_model('123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426655440000')
print(json.dumps(model_details, indent=2))

get.description: Translates the input text from the source language to the target language.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: Input text in UTF-8 encoding. Multiple `text` entries will result in multiple translations in the response.

parameters.name: model_id
parameters.description: Model ID of the translation model to use. If this is specified, the **source** and **target** parameters will be ignored. The method requires either a model ID or both the **source** and **target** parameters.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Language code of the source text language. Use with `target` as an alternative way to select a translation model. When `source` and `target` are set, and a model ID is not set, the system chooses a default model for the language pair (usually the model based on the news domain).

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: Language code of the translation target language. Use with source as an alternative way to select a translation model.

404.description: Model Not Found: the specified model_id does not exist or specified source - target language pair is not supported

source:
curl -u "{username}":"{password}" \
-H "Accept: application/json" \
"https://gateway.watsonplatform.net/language-translator/api/v2/translate?model_id=en-es&text=Hello"

post.description: Translates the input text from the source language to the target language.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The translate request containing the text, and either a model ID or source and target language pair.

404.description: Model Not Found: the specified model_id does not exist or specified source - target language pair is not supported

source:
curl -u "{username}":"{password}" \
-X POST \
-H "Accept: application/json" \
-d '{"text":"Hello","model_id":"en-es"}' \
"https://gateway.watsonplatform.net/language-translator/api/v2/translate"

import json
from watson_developer_cloud import LanguageTranslatorV2 as LanguageTranslator

language_translator = LanguageTranslator(
    username='{username}',
    password='{password}')

translation = language_translator.translate(
    text='Hello',
    model_id='en-es')
print(json.dumps(translation, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False))

get.description: Lists the languages that the service can identify. Returns the language code (for example, `en` for English or `es` for Spanish) and name of each language.

source: curl -u "{username}":"{password}" \
"https://gateway.watsonplatform.net/language-translator/api/v2/identifiable_languages"

import json
from watson_developer_cloud import LanguageTranslatorV2 as LanguageTranslator

language_translator = LanguageTranslator(
    username='{username}',
    password='{password}')

languages = language_translator.list_identifiable_languages()
print(json.dumps(languages, indent=2))

get.description: Identifies the language of the input text.

400.description: Bad Request: missing required text parameter

source:
curl -u "{username}":"{password}" \
-H "Accept: application/json" \
"https://gateway.watsonplatform.net/language-translator/api/v2/identify?text=this+is+a+test"

post.description: Identifies the language of the input text.

400.description: Bad Request: missing required input text in request body

source:
curl -u "{username}":"{password}" \
-H "Content-Type: text/plain" \
-H "Accept: application/json" \
-X POST \
-d "this is a test" \
"https://gateway.watsonplatform.net/language-translator/api/v2/identify"

import json
from watson_developer_cloud import LanguageTranslatorV2 as LanguageTranslator

language_translator = LanguageTranslator(
    username='{username}',
    password='{password}')

language = language_translator.identify('this is a test')
print(json.dumps(language, indent=2))

TranslationModels.description: The response type for listing existing translation models.

model_id.description: A globally unique string that identifies the underlying model that is used for translation

name.description: Optional name that can be specified when the model is created.

base_model_id.description: Model ID of the base model that was used to customize the model. If the model is not a custom model, this will be an empty string.

domain.description: The domain of the translation model.

customizable.description: Whether this model can be used as a base for customization. Customized models are not further customizable, and some base models are not customizable.

default_model.description: Whether or not the model is a default model. A default model is the model for a given language pair that will be used when that language pair is specified in the source and target parameters.

owner.description: Either an empty string, indicating the model is not a custom model, or the ID of the service instance that created the model.

status.description: "OK" indicates that the model was successfully deleted.

text.description: Input text in UTF-8 encoding. Multiple entries will result in multiple translations in the response.

model_id.description: Model ID of the translation model to use. If this is specified, the **source** and **target** parameters will be ignored. The method requires either a model ID or both the **source** and **target** parameters.

source.description: Language code of the source text language. Use with `target` as an alternative way to select a translation model. When `source` and `target` are set, and a model ID is not set, the system chooses a default model for the language pair (usually the model based on the news domain).

target.description: Language code of the translation target language. Use with source as an alternative way to select a translation model.

word_count.description: Number of words in the input text.

character_count.description: Number of characters in the input text.

translations.description: List of translation output in UTF-8, corresponding to the input text entries.

languages.description: A list of all languages that the service can identify.

language.description: The language code for an identifiable language.

name.description: The name of the identifiable language.

languages.description: A ranking of identified languages with confidence scores.

language.description: The language code for an identified language.

confidence.description: The confidence score for the identified language.

error_code.description: A short identifier for the error.

error_message.description: A more detailed description of the error.
